headline: Does Raised Guidance After a Soft Quarter Change The Bull Case For Kroger (KR)?
summary: Kroger recently reported mixed Q3 CY2025 results, with flat year-on-year sales, revenue below market expectations, and a GAAP loss per share that fell well short of analyst forecasts. Despite the weaker quarter, management raised full-year earnings guidance above consensus, signaling confidence in the underlying business amid ongoing regulatory scrutiny of the proposed Albertsons merger. With Kroger’s full-year earnings guidance now topping analyst expectations despite a soft quarter, we’ll...
